metric.originalName: Initialize the variable while defining it
Avoid return Pointer, because memory exists and is destroyed automatically at the end of the function body
Once memory is applied with malloc, it should be immediately checked whether the pointer value is NULL
Set the pointer to NULL immediately after freeing memory with free to prevent 'Wild Pointers'
Boolean variables can not be compared directly to true, false, or 1, 0
Integer variables should use '==' or '!=' for directly comparing to 0
Floating point variables can not compare to any number with an '==' or '!='
Pointer variables should use '==' or '!=' compared with NULL
Each case branch of the switch statement should have comments
